name: Elite Gourmet EFD319 Food Dehydrator, 5 BPA-Free 11.4" Trays Adjustable Temperature Controls, Jerky, Herbs, Fruit, Veggies, Dried Snacks, Black
about_this_item: ADJUSTABLE TEMPERATURE from 95ºF to 158ºF that foods are dehydrated at their optimal temperature and horizontal air flow distributes heat evenly and efficiently.
HEALTHY SNACKS: Prepare 100% all-natural dehydrated foods and snacks with no added sugars, additives or preservatives. No more processed junk food, dry healthy fruit rolls, trail mix, granola, etc.
FUN AND CRAFTS: Perfect for hobbyists to dry flowers, potpourri or dough crafts and pet lovers to prepare healthy and delicious 100% natural treats for their furry companions.
EVEN HEAT DISTRIBUTION: using a base mounted fan promotes even drying and air circulation. Large viewing window allows you to monitor the drying process.
SAFETY TESTED: ETL Listed at 350W of power / 120V is perfect for home use. Do not use outdoors. Dishwasher safe removable parts.
1 YEAR WARRANTY and U.S. based customer support team means you can buy with confidence.
Includes 5 x BPA Free Trays that are fully immersible and dishwasher safe.

title: Works well for the value
content: Received a few weeks ago. First effort was strawberries, which instructions indicated would take 8-10 hrs. Took almost twice that, rotating trays,, and never completely dehydrated. Next effort was basil. Should have been an easy one, taking just 4-6 hrs at low setting. Ran for 12 hrs at that setting, but nothing dried. Upped the temp and ran another 6 hrs. Still didn't dehydrate, so I trashed them. Not hopeful that this will ever work, but will try a few more items before I send it back.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024

I've made several batches of beef and pork jerky, and dehydrated fruits including strawberries, mango, pineapple, and apple.  I also have made blueberry banana fruit leather.  I love it so far.  My only comment is that I have to rotate the racks top to bottom to get more even dehydrating.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I had a bumper crop of all sorts of tomatoes and decided to get on the dehydrator train and see if I could put some aside for cooking later. The dehydrator price is so low (imho) that I thought it couldn't possibly be any good but... I'm relatively pleased with it.  I don't like the temp controls for two reasons: 1) I wish companies would stop using a small bump or arrow on a black dial, making it virtually impossible to see the setting. 2) this dehydrator has three temp ranges, not a specific temp you dial in. You want 135º for your use, nope, gotta guesstimate that on the black on black dial. It does do the job. The trays are not easy to clean but not terribly hard. Easy to access, but of course the food sticks in the holes in the trays. The biggest bummer is the stacking arrangement. The trays a fiddly to set and to adjust, not impossible, just a bit of a pain. After all that you might wonder if I'd buy it again, and yes, I would. The price compensates for the little things that bug me. :D
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: The machine is very nice. It works perfectly and I made chicken jerky for my dog. It was very easy. The trays are nice it’s easy to clean quiet. I had one like this years ago. And loved it and used it often. I have almost my culinary degree. My daughter is a personal chef. It arrived on time and it is good. I do like it a lot. I moved years ago so I didn’t have my dehydrator and I wasn’t sure I wanted to replace it but after getting it again I remember how much I missed it. It litterally pays for itself in a couple uses. Last year I bought dehydrator fruits as a gift. This machine I can make the fruits myself for presents. I cook for the police and fire department as gifts. This is chef quality product. Thank you. With my dog it cost like 11 dollars for a page of treats. I can get a whole tray of chicken for 15 dollars and have like 88 dollars of treats for that much. The savings is unreal. The quietness of the sound of the machine is perfect. It gives a white noise background which is very nice. I highly recommend. But there is no buzzer as far as I can see. The person using this divise will have to turn it off. You have the responsibility to turn off the machine after five or 6 hours. So it is for an adult.

title: Awesome Machine
content: This thing is an unbelievable jerky making machine. Right out of the box, I ran 2 batches of jerky through it, did 2 batches of garlic and a batch of mushrooms.  It literally ran non stop for 3 days after I opened it. Super efficient. Almost Silent. And a breeze to clean. And unlike some other dehydrators I've had over the years, this one has two tray height settings and the temperature controll is spot on. I checked it with my infrared thermometer and the temperature was consistent throughout the cycle. I was able to take my jerky down to 6% moisture (my preferred moisture content for long term storage) without any problems at all. To be honest I wasn't expecting much for the price, but I was blown away with this units performance.  I ordered a second one, and I'll have one just for meats and one strictly for vegetables. I would recommend this unit to anyone who wants to preserve foods or make jerky. EXCELLENT VALUE!!!!!!!! 👏 Bravo!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I had wanted a dehydrator and finally bit the bullet and got one. I was tired of paying the prices for beef jerky during a time when I was eating  a lot of it because of how much hiking I was doing. It is a great snack to bring along for those adventures. After getting this I have made a lot of batches of beef jerky and this is a great dehydrator for drying meat. I have done strawberries and bananas, but I am not as big of a fan of dried fruit. An item I’d like to try next year is drying tomatoes and making sun dried tomatoes in an olive oil as a way of preserving tomatoes since I usually get quite a few. It takes a little longer than other dehydrators, and you may not be able to do as much, but it is a great beginner dehydrator. This product also is not digitally controlled but it is pretty accurate.

title: Nice little dehydrator. Seriously!
content: Nice little dehydrator. I ordered and received it. I didn't realize it only had 11" plates when I ordered. I was replacing a dehydrator that had almost 13" plates which barely had enough space for my needs so was disappointed when I saw it. It wasn't going to serve my needs so I returned it to order a bigger one. But before I sent it back I decided to test it. First I really like the feature which allows you to increase the height of the stack on each tray so the one above it doesn't sit right on top of what you're dehydrating. My old one didn't have that feature. Next I like the ability to adjust the temp. It doesn't have a thermostat. It just turns the heat on and off at variable timing like a rheostat. I used my digital thermometer to cycle through and check if it actually hit the temperature ranges as shown on the nob panel. It did but when placed on the highest setting it had to cycle about 6-7 times before hitting that range. So it builds slowly but does get there. That range being to high in my opinion to be used for dehydrating anyway. 158 degrees. So at $42 I highly recommend if you're OK with 11" plates. I'd definitely buy a bigger one from them if they made one!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023

title: I found that it was very easy to use
content: I purchased this because the dog treats that I purchased for my dogs were getting so expensive. I have four large dogs and the treats originally were about 8.99 for a 37 oz. container. Over the course of about a year and a half, the price went up to $19 a container. I told my husband, it would be cheaper for me to buy meat and slice it, dehydrated it, and give that to our dogs. So that’s what we do. I buy meat when it’s on sale, slice it up (with an electric meat slicer I purchased), marinade it, put it in bags, and put it in the freezer until we need to dehydrate it. Our dogs love them, and they’re healthier too.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
